thread.title: WATCH: UCLA kicker breaks school record, nails 60-yard field goal
thread.title_full: WATCH: UCLA kicker breaks school record, nails 60-yard field goal

title: WATCH: UCLA kicker breaks school record, nails 60-yard field goal
text:
WATCH: UCLA kicker breaks school record, nails 60-yard field goal 
Faibairn's field goal was a school record. Richard Mackson / USA TODAY Sports Oct 22, 2015 at 11:02p ET 0Shares 
UCLA kicker Ka'imi Fairbairn looked like one of the best kickers in the country against Cal, nailing a 60-yard field goal. 

Fairbairn first hit a 55-yard attempt, but the call was reversed because of a UCLA illegal procedure and he was moved back five yards. Then, as time expired in the first half against the Golden Bears, he hit a 60-yard field goal with smooth precision. It was the second-longest field goal in Pac-12 history, per ESPN Stats & Info. 
MORE NEWS: Want stories delivered to you? Sign up for our College Football newsletters. 
UCLA head coach Jim Mora ran onto the field as his team mobbed him with celebration. The score gave the Bruins a 26-10 lead at the half. It was Fairbairn's fourth field goal of the evening.
